meanings.definition: The basic unit of a chemical element.
meanings.sent1: An atom is like a building block for elements.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the behavior of atoms in chemistry.
meanings.sent3: I only have an atom of knowledge about this subject.
meanings.sent4: Her smile lit up the room like a glowing atom.
meanings.sent5: The atom danced in the microscope, revealing its structure.

meanings.definition: A tiny particle that makes up all matter.
meanings.sent1: The atom is so small that it cannot be seen with the naked eye.
meanings.sent2: Atoms combine to form molecules in nature.
meanings.sent3: He collected every atom of dust in the house for his experiment.
meanings.sent4: Love can be as powerful as a single atom in the universe.
meanings.sent5: The atom buzzed with energy, ready to bond with others.

meanings.sent1: She only had an atom of patience left after waiting for hours.
meanings.sent2: Adding just an atom of salt can enhance the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent3: He felt an atom of guilt for eating the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The excitement in the room was palpable, just an atom away from bursting.
meanings.sent5: The atom of doubt grew into a mountain of uncertainty.
